thread.title: NHL: Arizona Coyotes turn back Los Angeles Kings
thread.title_full: NHL: Arizona Coyotes turn back Los Angeles Kings

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Arizona Coyotes turn back Los Angeles Kings
text:
NHL: Arizona Coyotes turn back Los Angeles Kings Associated Press Posted: 10/09/2015 09:13:07 PM PDT Updated: 10/09/2015 11:53:48 PM PDT friDAY'S nhl HIGHLIGHTS Coyotes 4, Kings 1: Max Domi had a goal and an assist in his NHL debut to help Arizona beat Los Angeles. Domi, the son of former NHL enforcer Tie Domi, scored 4:43 into the second period. 
Center Mike Richards and the Kings settled their dispute over the termination of Richards' contract after his arrest in June. The NHL Players' Association announced the settlement without disclosing the terms. Blackhawks 3, Islanders 2: Jonathan Toews scored on a power play at 1:49 of overtime to give Chicago a victory against New York, spoiling the Islanders' debut in Brooklyn. 
Rangers 4, Blue Jackets 2: New York scored three times in just over a minute in the third period to rally to a win over Columbus. 
Red Wings 4, Maple Leafs 0: Justin Abdelkader had a hat trick and Dylan Larkin scored in his NHL debut, helping Detroit beat Mike Babcock-led Toronto. 
Jets 3, Devils 1: Winnipeg beat New Jersey to spoil John Hynes' NHL coaching debut. 
Ducks: Defenseman Simon Despres agreed to a five-year, $18.5 million contract extension with Anaheim, punctuating his remarkable six-month rise with the Ducks. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
